meanings.definition: A man's formal evening coat with a long back and short front.
meanings.sent1: He wore a fancy tailcoat to the elegant party.
meanings.sent2: The gentleman looked dashing in his black tailcoat.
meanings.sent3: At the ball, everyone admired his stylish tailcoat.
meanings.sent4: His tailcoat fluttered behind him as he danced gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The tailcoat added a touch of sophistication to his outfit.

meanings.definition: The lower part of a coat or dress that hangs down at the back.
meanings.sent1: The tailcoat of her dress swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the length of the tailcoat to match her shoes.
meanings.sent3: The tailcoat of the coat gave it a unique flair.
meanings.sent4: Her dress with a long tailcoat made her feel like a princess.
meanings.sent5: The tailcoat added an elegant touch to her outfit.

meanings.definition: To follow or spy on someone closely.
meanings.sent1: He decided to tailcoat his suspect to gather more evidence.
meanings.sent2: The detective quietly tailcoated the suspect through the crowded street.
meanings.sent3: Trying to tailcoat someone without being noticed can be tricky.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a secret agent as she tried to tailcoat her friend.
meanings.sent5: The spy managed to tailcoat the target without raising any suspicion.
